Center: OECD/NEA Nuclear Data Bank, Boulogne-Billancourt, France
title: A systematic study of (n,7Be) reactions on medium and heavy mass nuclei induced by 53 MeV d(Be)-Breakup neutrons

x4freetext: A systematic study of (n,7Be) reactions on medium and
heavy mass nuclei induced by 53 MeV d(Be)-Breakup

x4codes.shortRef: Conf: Conf.on Nucl.Data for Sci.and Technol.,Juelich 1991, p.711 (1991)

x4freetext: The 53 MeV deuteron beam impinging on a 1 cm
thick water-cooled Be disc produced breakup neutrons
which were very strongly forward peaked.
The elements to be irradiated were packed between Al
monitor foils. The thickness of each packing
containing several elements was kept between 0.8 and
Mean neutron flux density of about 3.x10**10 n/cm2/sec
The neutron spectrum in the 0.degr. direction was
characterized by TOF technique over the neutron energy
range of 11.5 to 43.5 MeV by Schweimer and 4 to 50 MeV
by Meulders et al. (see REL-REF). The averaged result
extrapolated up to 53 MeV  was used as a standard in
the present work. The integrated neutron flux was
Originally adopted spectrum is in EXFOR Subent
Then neutron spectrum shape was reconstructed using
extensive measurement data ( 4- 50 MeV energy range)
Energy   Neutron yield       Energy   Neutron yield
